metadata.description: Class 9 Science - Chapter 7: Diversity in Living Organisms

question.text: (CBSE 2023) Which phylum includes animals with spiny skin and tube feet?
question.explanation: Echinodermata: spiny-skinned marine animals with water vascular system and tube feet (e.g., starfish, sea urchin).

question.text: (SEBA 2023) The scientific name of mango is:
question.explanation: Binomial nomenclature: Genus capitalized, species lowercase, italicized when printed. Mangifera indica (mango).

question.text: (CBSE 2022) Which group of plants is called "amphibians of plant kingdom"?
question.explanation: Bryophytes (mosses, liverworts) need water for reproduction, live in moist habitats but on land, hence "plant amphibians".

question.text: (SEBA 2022) Which phylum includes animals with jointed legs?
question.explanation: Arthropoda: largest phylum, jointed appendages, chitinous exoskeleton, segmented body (insects, spiders, crustaceans).

question.text: (CBSE 2021) The five-kingdom classification was proposed by:
question.explanation: Robert Whittaker (1969): Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae, Animalia. Based on cell structure, nutrition, reproduction.

question.text: (SEBA 2021) Which group of plants has naked seeds?
question.explanation: Gymnosperms: "naked seeds" not enclosed in ovary (e.g., pine, cycas, deodar). Angiosperms: seeds in fruits.

question.text: (CBSE 2020) Which is NOT a characteristic of mammals?
question.explanation: Mammals are warm-blooded (endothermic). Cold-blooded (ectothermic): fish, amphibians, reptiles.

question.text: (SEBA 2020) The basic unit of classification is:
question.explanation: Species: group of interbreeding individuals producing fertile offspring. Basic taxonomic unit.

question.text: (CBSE 2019) Which protozoan causes malaria?
question.explanation: Plasmodium (protozoan) causes malaria, transmitted by female Anopheles mosquito. Entamoeba causes amoebic dysentery.

question.text: (SEBA 2019) Which group of animals has three-chambered heart?
question.explanation: Amphibians: 3-chambered heart (2 atria, 1 ventricle). Fish: 2-chambered. Birds/mammals: 4-chambered. Reptiles: mostly 3 (crocodiles 4).

question.text: (CBSE 2018) Fungi are:
question.explanation: Fungi: heterotrophic (saprophytic/parasitic), chitin cell walls, reproduce by spores. Yeast, mushrooms, molds.

question.text: (SEBA 2018) The book "Origin of Species" was written by:
question.explanation: Charles Darwin (1859) proposed theory of evolution by natural selection in "On the Origin of Species".

question.text: Father of taxonomy is:
question.explanation: Linnaeus: introduced binomial nomenclature, hierarchical classification (Kingdom → Species).

question.text: Which kingdom includes bacteria?
question.explanation: Monera: prokaryotic, unicellular (bacteria, cyanobacteria). No nucleus, membrane-bound organelles.

question.text: Which group has seeds enclosed in fruits?
question.explanation: Angiosperms: flowering plants, seeds in fruits (ovary wall). Divided into monocots and dicots.

question.text: Which phylum includes snails and octopus?
question.explanation: Mollusca: soft-bodied, muscular foot, mantle, calcareous shell (snails, octopus, squid, oysters). Second largest phylum.

question.text: Which is NOT a vertebrate class?
question.explanation: Arthropoda is invertebrate phylum. Vertebrates: Pisces, Amphibia, Reptilia, Aves, Mammalia.

question.text: Which plant group has vascular tissues but no seeds?
question.explanation: Pteridophytes: ferns, horsetails; have xylem/phloem but reproduce by spores, need water for fertilization.

question.text: Which is a cold-blooded vertebrate with scales?
question.explanation: Reptiles: dry scaly skin, cold-blooded, lay eggs on land (snakes, lizards, crocodiles, turtles).

question.text: Which protozoan moves using pseudopodia?
question.explanation: Amoeba: moves and feeds using pseudopodia (false feet). Paramecium: cilia, Euglena: flagella, Plasmodium: no locomotion.

question.text: Which is the largest group of animals?
question.explanation: Arthropoda: >1 million species (85% of all animals). Insects alone >750,000 species.

question.text: Which classification category is broader than genus but narrower than class?
question.explanation: Hierarchy: Kingdom → Phylum → Class → Order → Family → Genus → Species. Order between class and family.

question.text: Which group has specialized tissue for conduction but not true roots/stems/leaves?
question.explanation: Bryophytes: simple conductive tissues but no true vascular bundles, no true roots (rhizoids), stems, leaves.

question.text: Which is NOT a feature of birds?
question.explanation: Birds: feathers, forelimbs modified to wings, pneumatic bones, no external ears (have ear openings).

question.text: Which phylum includes earthworm and leech?
question.explanation: Annelida: segmented worms, closed circulatory system (earthworm, leech, nereis).

question.text: Which plant division is called "algae"?
question.explanation: Thallophyta: plant body thallus (undifferentiated), mainly algae (Spirogyra, Ulva, Chlamydomonas).

question.text: Which is an example of gymnosperm?
question.explanation: Pine (Pinus) is gymnosperm. Mango: angiosperm, Fern: pteridophyte, Moss: bryophyte.

question.text: Which group has notochord at some life stage?
question.explanation: Chordates: notochord, dorsal nerve cord, pharyngeal slits, post-anal tail at some stage. Includes vertebrates and protochordates.

question.text: Which fungi is used in baking?
question.explanation: Saccharomyces cerevisiae (yeast) used in baking (fermentation), brewing. Penicillium: antibiotic.

question.text: Which animal has radial symmetry?
question.explanation: Radial symmetry: body parts arranged around central axis (cnidarians like Hydra, jellyfish, echinoderms). Bilateral: two symmetrical halves.

question.text: Which is a monocot plant?
question.explanation: Monocots: single cotyledon, parallel venation, fibrous roots (maize, wheat, rice, lily). Dicots: two cotyledons, reticulate venation, taproot.

question.text: Which protozoan has chlorophyll?
question.explanation: Euglena: photosynthetic flagellate, has chlorophyll, can also ingest food (mixotrophic). Others are heterotrophic.

question.text: Which is NOT a feature of mammals?
question.explanation: Most mammals give birth to young ones (viviparous). Exception: monotremes (platypus, echidna) lay eggs.

question.text: Which classification system considered only two kingdoms?
question.explanation: Linnaeus: Plantae and Animalia only. Whittaker: 5 kingdoms. Three-domain: Archaea, Bacteria, Eukarya (Woese).

question.text: Which group has pseudocoelom?
question.explanation: Nematoda (roundworms): pseudocoelom (body cavity not lined by mesoderm). Platyhelminthes: acoelomate. Annelida: true coelom.

question.text: Which is NOT an arachnid?
question.explanation: Arachnids: spiders, scorpions, ticks, mites (4 pairs legs). Crab is crustacean (arthropod). Insects: 3 pairs legs.

question.text: The study of classification is called:
question.option: Physiology Taxonomy: science of classification. Nomenclature: naming. Systematics: evolutionary relationships.
